content:
OECD Glossary of Statistical Terms

27

10

1

To provide an appropriate summary and global overview, the Economic Outlook projections for individual countries and regions, both OECD and non-OECD, are commonly aggregated into and reported separately for regional and economic groupings and also at the total OECD and world levels. For example regional and global aggregates are commonly reported in the summary tables and thematic tables included in the General Assessment of the Macroeconomic Situation chapter and its Statistical Annex.

Aggregate series are typically constructed for the most important variables, including gross domestic product (GDP) and its demand components, inflation and labour market indicators, the government accounts and international trade related variables.

The OECD Secretariat uses different weigthting methods to define the country’s share of the total value.Aggregation of data into regionsSee Gross domestic product (GDP)GDPPIBSee Gross Domestic Product - expenditure-basedGDP – expenditure basedPIB, dans l’optique des dépensesSee Gross Domestic Product Income-basedGDP – income basedLe PIB, dans l’optique du revenuSee Gross Domestic Product Output-basedGDP – output basedPIB aux prix du marchéSee Gross Domestic Product at constant pricesGDP at constant pricesSee Gross Domestic Product - current pricesGDP at current pricesSee Gross Domestic Product at market pricesGDP at market pricesSee Gross domestic product (GDP) deflatorGDP deflatorGreen GDP is a popular term for environmentally adjusted gross domestic productGreen GDPPIB vert
